heritage->Woodland Elf.name: Woodland Elf
heritage->Woodland Elf.description:
You're adapted to life in the forest or the deep jungle, and you know how to climb trees and use foliage to your advantage. When @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climbing} trees, vines, and other foliage, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.P04Hw8E6WAWARKHP]{Quick Climb}). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed.

You can always use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} action when you are within forest terrain to gain cover, even if you're not next to an obstacle you can take cover behind.

0.text: Cuando trepas a árboles, enredaderas u otro follaje, te mueves a la mitad de tu velocidad si tienes éxito y a toda velocidad si tienes éxito crítico.

background->Guard.name: Guard
background->Guard.description:
You served in the guard, out of either patriotism or the need for coin. Either way, you know how to get a difficult suspect to talk. However you left the guard, you might think of adventuring as a way to use your skills on a wider stage.

Choose two ability boosts. One must be to Strength or Charisma, and one is a free ability boost.

You're trained in the Intimidation skill, and the Legal Lore skill or Warfare Lore skill. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.ar2DUlvDK4LDcH9J]{Quick Coercion} skill feat.

feat->Quick Coercion.name: Quick Coercion
feat->Quick Coercion.description: You can bully others with just a few choice implications. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} a creature after 1 round of conversation instead of 1 minute. You still can't Coerce a creature in the midst of combat, or without engaging in a conversation.

feat->Nimble Elf.name: Nimble Elf
feat->Nimble Elf.description: Your muscles are tightly honed. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

feat->Ancestral Longevity.name: Ancestral Longevity
feat->Ancestral Longevity.description: You have accumulated a vast array of lived knowledge over the years. During your daily preparations, you can reflect upon your life experiences to gain the trained proficiency rank in one skill of your choice. This proficiency lasts until you prepare again. Since this proficiency is temporary, you can't use it as a prerequisite for a skill increase or a permanent character option like a feat.

feat->Harming Hands.name: Harming Hands
feat->Harming Hands.description: The mordant power of your void energy grows. When you cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, you roll d10s instead of d8s.

feat->Channel Smite.name: Channel Smite
feat->Channel Smite.description:
Cost Expend a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell.

You siphon the destructive energies of vitality or void energy through a melee attack and into your foe.

Make a melee Strike and add the spell's damage to the Strike's damage.

This is void damage if you expended a harm spell or vitality damage if you expended a heal spell. The spell is expended with no effect if your Strike fails or hits a creature that isn't damaged by that energy type (such as if you hit a non-undead creature with a heal spell).

feat->Divine Weapon.name: Divine Weapon
feat->Divine Weapon.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger You finish Casting a Spell using one of your divine spell slots on your turn.

You siphon residual spell energy into a weapon you're wielding. Until the end of your turn, the weapon deals an additional 1d4 force damage.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.zZ25N1zpXA8GNhFL]{Effect: Divine Weapon (Force)}

You can instead deal an additional 1d6 damage of an alignment type that matches one of your deity's alignment components. As usual for aligned damage, this can damage only creatures of the opposite alignment.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.zZ25N1zpXA8GNhFL]{Effect: Divine Weapon}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.zZ25N1zpXA8GNhFL]{Effect: Divine Weapon}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.zZ25N1zpXA8GNhFL]{Effect: Divine Weapon}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.zZ25N1zpXA8GNhFL]{Effect: Divine Weapon}

feat->Intimidating Glare.name: Intimidating Glare
feat->Intimidating Glare.description: You can Demoralize with a mere glare. When you do, Demoralize loses the auditory trait and gains the visual trait, and you don't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand your language.

feat->Group Coercion.name: Group Coercion
feat->Group Coercion.description: When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, you can compare your Intimidation check result to the Will DCs of two targets instead of one. It's possible to get a different degree of success for each target. The number of targets you can Coerce in a single action increases to four if you're an expert, 10 if you're a master, and 25 if you're legendary.

feat->Combat Climber.name: Combat Climber
feat->Combat Climber.description: Your techniques allow you to fight as you climb. You're not off-guard while Climbing and can Climb with a hand occupied. You must still use another hand and both legs to Climb.

feat->Armor Proficiency.name: Armor Proficiency
feat->Armor Proficiency.description:
You become trained in light armor. If you already were trained in light armor, you gain training in medium armor. If you were trained in both, you become trained in heavy armor.

Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time, you become trained in the next type of armor above.

spell->Chill Touch.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.mAMEt4FFbdqoRnkN]
Toque frío
spell->Chill Touch.description:
Siphoning void energy into yourself, your hand radiates a pale darkness. Your touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.

  • Living Creature The spell deals void damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round on a critical failure.
  • Undead Creature The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.

Heightened (+1) The void damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower rank than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bikFUFRLwfdvX2x2]{Invisibility Potion}) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the rank or level of the most powerful magical effect the spell detects, as determined by the GM.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd rank, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-rank magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Guidance.name: Guidance
spell->Guidance.description:
You ask for divine guidance, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3qHKBDF7lrHw8jFK]{Spell Effect: Guidance}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3LyOkV25p7wA181H]{Effect: Guidance Immunity}

spell->Message.name: Message
spell->Message.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you.

The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.QF6RDlCoTvkVHRo4]{Effect: Shield Immunity}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

spell->Command.name: Command
spell->Command.description:
You shout a command that's hard to ignore. You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition), release what it's holding, drop @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, or stand in place. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.

Critical Failure The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.

Heightened (5th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Ray of Enfeeblement.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]
Rayo de debilitamiento
spell->Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A ray that saps a foe's strength flashes from your hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If you succeed, that creature attempts a Fortitude save to determine the spell's effect. If your attack roll is a critical success, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.

spell->True Strike.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]
Golpe verdadero
spell->True Strike.description:
A glimpse into the future ensures your next blow strikes true. The next time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, roll the attack twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.fpGDAz2v5PG0zUSl]{Spell Effect: Sure Strike}

spell->Heal.name: Heal
spell->Heal.description:
You channel vitality energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, you restore 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, you deal that amount of vitality damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8

3 (material, somatic, verbal) You disperse vitality energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

spell->Harm.name: Harm
spell->Harm.description:
You channel void energy to harm the living or heal the undead. If the target is a living creature, you deal 1d8 void damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, you restore that amount of Hit Points. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing an undead creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.

3 (material, verbal, somatic) You disperse void energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the area.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
spell->Harm.target: 1 living creature or 1 willing undead creature

spell->Harm.name: Harm
spell->Harm.description:
You channel void energy to harm the living or heal the undead. If the target is a living creature, you deal 1d8 void damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, you restore that amount of Hit Points. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing an undead creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.

3 (material, verbal, somatic) You disperse void energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the area.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
spell->Harm.target: 1 living creature or 1 willing undead creature

spell->Invisibility.name: Invisibility
spell->Invisibility.description:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

spell->Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
spell->Spiritual Weapon.description:
A weapon made of pure magical force materializes and attacks foes you designate within range. This weapon has a ghostly appearance and manifests as a club, a dagger, or your deity's favored weapon.

When you cast the spell, the weapon appears next to a foe you choose within range and makes a Strike against it. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can move the weapon to a new target within range (if needed) and Strike with it. The spiritual weapon uses and contributes to your multiple attack penalty.

The weapon's Strikes are melee spell attacks. Regardless of its appearance, the weapon deals 2d8 force damage. You can deal damage of the type normally dealt by the weapon instead of force damage (or any of the available damage types for a versatile weapon). No other statistics or traits of the weapon apply, and even a ranged weapon attacks adjacent creatures only. Despite making a spell attack, the spiritual weapon is a weapon for purposes of triggers, resistances, and so forth.

The weapon doesn't take up space, grant flanking, or have any other attributes a creature would. The weapon can't make any attack other than its Strike, and feats or spells that affect weapons do not apply to it.

Heightened (+2) The weapon's damage increases by 1d8.

spell->Blindness.name: Blindness
spell->Blindness.description:
You blind the target. The effect is determined by the target's Fortitude save. The target then becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until its next turn begins.

Failure The target is Blinded for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is Blinded permanently.

spell->Heroism.name: Heroism
spell->Heroism.description:
You tap into the target's inner heroism, granting it a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks.

Heightened (6th) The status bonus increases to +2.

Heightened (9th) The status bonus increases to +3.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.l9HRQggofFGIxEse]{Spell Effect: Heroism}

spell->Weapon Surge.name: Weapon Surge
spell->Weapon Surge.description:
Holding your weapon aloft, you fill it with divine energy.

On your next Strike with that weapon before the start of your next turn, you gain a +1 status bonus to the attack roll and the weapon deals an additional die of damage.

If the weapon has a striking rune, this instead increases the number of dice from the striking rune by 1 (to a maximum of 3 extra weapon dice).

If the target weapon leaves your possession, weapon surge immediately ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.qlz0sJIvqc0FdUdr]{Spell Effect: Weapon Surge}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.W0PjCMyGOpKAuyKX]{Spell Effect: Weapon Surge (Major Striking)}

weapon->Sling.name: Sling
weapon->Sling.description: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

weapon->Sawtooth Saber.name: Sawtooth Saber
weapon->Sawtooth Saber.description: The signature weapon of the Red Mantis assassins, this curved blade is serrated like a saw, hence the name.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment->Mantis Mask of Fear.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.2gYZiUw9yjtb0yJY]
Máscara Mantis del Miedo
equipment->Mantis Mask of Fear.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.2gYZiUw9yjtb0yJY]

Esta aterradora máscara está elaborada con el rostro de un demonio lascivo y otorga una bonificación de +1 por objeto a las pruebas de Intimidación.

Activar 2 Interactuar

Frecuencia una vez al día

Efecto La máscara proyecta un @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear} hechizo con una CD de 20.

equipment->Ventriloquist's Ring.name: Ventriloquist's Ring
equipment->Ventriloquist's Ring.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.1r6StS0irdvi5JHY]

Este elegante anillo de cobre tiene imágenes en miniatura de pájaros cantores grabadas alrededor de su circunferencia. Obtienes una bonificación de +1 por objeto a las pruebas de Engaño.

Activar 2 Interactuar

Frecuencia una vez al día

Efecto Torcer elEl anillo alrededor de tu dedo te permite lanzar mágicamente tu voz, con los efectos de un hechizo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yV7Ouzaoe7DHLESI]{Ventriloquism} (CD 19).

consumable->Antidote (Lesser).name: Antidote (Lesser)
consumable->Antidote (Lesser).description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ktjFOp3U0wQD9t0Z]

Activar A Interactuar

Un antídoto te protege contra las toxinas. Al beber un antídoto, obtienes una bonificación de +2 por objeto a las tiradas de salvación de Fortaleza contra venenos durante 6 horas.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7z1iY4AaNEAIKuAU]{Effect: Antidote (Lesser)}

consumable->Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
consumable->Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

consumable->Feather Step Stone.name: Feather Step Stone
consumable->Feather Step Stone.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.0CNSvLpeSM4aIfPJ]

Esta piedra, generalmente con forma de cabujón, es un pequeño trozo de ámbar con un trozo de pluma o un insecto volador atrapado en su interior. Cuando activas la piedra, ignoras los efectos de cualquier terreno difícil y de mayor dificultad por el que te muevas hasta el final de tu turno.

Uso fijado a la armadura

Activar F Imaginar

Desencadenante Tu zancada o paso

Requisitos Eres experto en Acrobacia

consumable->Hunting Spider Venom.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5RGNjhDxZ0yMhTds]
Cazando veneno de araña
consumable->Hunting Spider Venom.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5RGNjhDxZ0yMhTds]

Este veneno erosiona las defensas de su objetivo, ayudando a la araña a asegurar su presa.

Activar 2 Interactuar (Lesión)

Tiro de salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]

Duración máxima 6 rondas

Etapa 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] daño y @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} (1 ronda)

Etapa 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] daño, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 1} y ​​desprevenido (1 asalto)

Etapa 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] daño, torpe 2 y desprevenido (1 asalto)

consumable->Scroll of Faerie Fire (Level.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Y7UD64foDbDMV9sx]
Pergamino de fuego de hadas (nivel 2)
consumable->Scroll of Faerie Fire (Level.consumableSpellDescription: Todas las criaturas en el área cuando lanzas el hechizo quedan cubiertas por un fuego colorido y sin calor de un color de tu elección mientras dure. Las criaturas visibles no pueden ser @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W] {Oculto} mientras estén afectadas por el fuego de las hadas. Si las criaturas son @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML] {Invisible} , están Ocultas mientras estén afectadas por el fuego de las hadas, en lugar de ser @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf] {No detectado} .
consumable->Scroll of Faerie Fire (Level.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Y7UD64foDbDMV9sx]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}

Lanzar un hechizo desde un pergamino requiere sostener el pergamino en una mano y activarlo con una actividad de Lanzar un hechizo usando el número normal de acciones para ese hechizo.

Para lanzar un hechizo desde un pergamino, el hechizo debe aparecer en tu lista de hechizos. Como eres tú quien lanza el hechizo, usa tu tirada de ataque de hechizo ydeletrea DC. El hechizo también obtiene el rasgo apropiado para tu tradición (arcana, divina, oculta o primordial).

Todos los componentes materiales físicos y los costos se proporcionan cuando se crea un pergamino, por lo que no es necesario proporcionarlos al lanzar un hechizo a partir de un pergamino. Debes reemplazar cualquier componente material requerido para ese hechizo con un componente somático. Si el hechizo requiere un enfoque, debes tener ese enfoque para lanzar el hechizo desde un pergamino.

Nota: Para crear un pergamino o varita de un hechizo específico, arrastre el hechizo desde el compendio o navegador de compendio al inventario de un PC, NPC o actor de botín.
